From: robertdahl <rdahl@...>

Over a silent valley smoke rose up. In its blissful calm birds chirped,
as larger animals moved away from the crater ruins that lead for a few
miles, to a large alien craft. The Autobot's Hidden one, littered the
primitive natural apearance of the dirt. Beside it, a small clanking
could be heard. In another much smaller alien craft sitting only a few
feet away, a small robot figuere banged his fists against the winshield
of the bi-jet. Caliburst, a nebulan organic creature bio engenired to
become a weapon of mass destruction for a mechanic warrior race, tried
to escape his binary partners unintentional tomb.

"W, WAKE UP SLUGSLINGER." he pleaded worriedly. Ussually he didnt show
fear, as a famous actor he knew how to never show his real emotions, but
landing badly dammaged next to a huge ship carrying your mortal enemies
was a good reason to worry.

Finally the Bi-jet cockpit glass gave way to the metal knuckles, as it
shattered. Caliburst climbed from a blanket of glass, and looked around.
This bizzare planet reminded him of Nebula. The silence was ominous
however, as he was sure that the Autobot ship was looking at him.
Nervously he turned around, and began to whisper. "Get up Slugslinger,
we've got to get outta here before the Autobots get it together. We've
gotta find Havotron, he will protect us," he thought, remembering back
to Slugslinger threatening their leader.
______________________________________________________________________
Inside the large golden craft, in the pilot area, a form began to move
out of the rest of the fallen. "Ohhhhhh man, that was a kick in the
afterburner." the gruff voice commented, as a white Autobot pulled
himself up. Strafe, part of a group of five Autobot warriors who were
built by Grimlock to be the most versatile Gestalt ever, shook off the
cobwebs, as his head shifted at what would be painful angles for a human
being. As it went 180 degrees, and joint cracked, and a lose bolt popped
out. He looked around, and shook a nearby Scattershot, but lost
interest, as he looked out one of the windows at smoking wreckage.
"hmmmmmmmm." he thought outloud.
